definition: Czech/Czech Republic/abbr. for 捷克[Jie2 ke4]
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs

sentences.english: Dr Gammans travelled to the Czech Republic to learn the method.
sentences.chinese: 加曼斯博士專程到捷克共和國去學習這個方法。

sentences.english: Poland and the Czech Republic were client states of the former USSR for many years.
sentences.chinese: 波蘭和捷克共和國多年來是前蘇聯的附庸國。

sentences.english: The hotel is located in the very center of Pilsen, Czech Republic.
sentences.chinese: 酒店坐落在捷克共和國比爾森非常中心的位置。

sentences.english: Josef Werner was born in Kraslice (Czech Republic) in 1945.
sentences.chinese: 1945年出生於捷克共和國的克拉斯里斯。

sentences.english: So Belgium should swap places with the Czech Republic. The stolid, well-organised Czechs would get on splendidly with their new Dutch neighbours, and vice versa.
sentences.chinese: 因此，比利時應該和捷克共和國換位置。

sentences.english: But Aaron from the Czech Republic thinks testing is a good idea.
sentences.chinese: 而來自捷克共和國的亞倫則認爲檢測是個好主意。

sentences.english: Recently, in the Czech Republic, there was a proposal to increase the excise tax on smoking.
sentences.chinese: 最近，捷克共和國，有一個增加香菸消費稅的提案。

definition: Kenya (Tw) (written as 肯尼亞|肯尼亚 in PRC)

pinyin: Gang1 guo3 Min2 zhu3 Gong4 he2 guo2

definition: East Timor (officially Democratic Republic of Timor-Leste)
